H0.text: What paraffin-derived clear, transparent liquid developed in 1924 by W. J. Stoddard and Lloyd E. Jackson began to be used by dry cleaners in 1928 and has become a common organic solvent used in painting and decorating. Mineral Spirits

H1.text: What paraffin-derived clear, transparent liquid developed in 1924 by W. J. Stoddard and Lloyd E. Jackson began to be used by dry cleaners in 1928 and has become a common organic solvent used in painting and decorating. Turpentine

H2.text: What paraffin-derived clear, transparent liquid developed in 1924 by W. J. Stoddard and Lloyd E. Jackson began to be used by dry cleaners in 1928 and has become a common organic solvent used in painting and decorating. Naphtha

H3.text: What paraffin-derived clear, transparent liquid developed in 1924 by W. J. Stoddard and Lloyd E. Jackson began to be used by dry cleaners in 1928 and has become a common organic solvent used in painting and decorating. VARSOL

A4.text: Stoddard solvent is a specific mixture of hydrocarbons, developed in 1924 by W. J. Stoddard and Lloyd E. Jackson, and was used by dry cleaners starting in 1928.

A5.text: White spirit is a petroleum-derived clear liquid used as a common organic solvent in painting.
